Finally home, spent the whole day with grandaddy getting his new old truck.

the guy here likes old trucks too
rat rods, street rods, all that kinda shit
so I've seen a lot of that
Not my style, but I can see the appeal. Does look cool
We have a car show every Mule Day that shows cars like that
Old as dirt but still running
yeah all mechanical cars are much easier to maintain than cars with electronics.
It was totally rebuilt from the bottom up a few years ago, but the old owner passed away soon after the rebuild, so it has next to no miles on it yet.
The owner's son gave us this giant picture book full of the pictures that were taken chronicling the rebuild, was very cool to see what the truck went through.

You never know if anything you have in your car will go out.. and if it does, is the part still made? technology stops building old stuff, but old cars are all big chunks of metal and stuff for the most part.. you can piece em together from the junkyard l
not quite so easy for cars with electronics in em
Only problem was when we were nearly home, the radiator cap started pissing coolant, not ideal lol.
The cork seal in the cap had gone to shit, so an easy enough fix.
